definition: car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159
to beat easily/to gain an easy victory

sentences.english: You seem to turn some light.
This box is very light, and I move.
The personal clothing of this soldier of the future would be lightweight with a bullet-proof jacket.
sentences.chinese: 未来士兵的服装重量将更轻，并装备防弹背心。

sentences.english: A finger or stylus interrupts the light beams and position is determined on the grid.
sentences.chinese: 一只手指或者尖笔打断轻的梁，位置是决定闸极栏。

sentences.english: Below gave everyone a good feeling villages light rock song.
sentences.chinese: 下面送给大家一首好听的乡村轻摇滚感觉的歌。

sentences.english: I remember Thierry Henry flicking a ball over his head and scoring.
sentences.chinese: 我记得亨利轻挑一个球越过他头顶，然后破门。

sentences.english: And beyond that, swap them for White Jars when you're doing Light Crystal recipes.
sentences.chinese: 除此之外，他们掉白水晶瓶子当你做轻食谱。

sentences.english: And we need Soda Ash. Light.
The composite aggregate is composed of LWA and normal aggregate.
sentences.chinese: 复合骨料系混凝土中的普通骨料被轻骨料取代而成。

sentences.english: When a knife feels light in the hand, good balance has been achieved.
sentences.chinese: 如果一把刀在手里感到轻，说明到达了好的平衡。

sentences.english: Learn " to " re-check engine light from the mechanic.
sentences.chinese: 学习重置检查引擎轻程序从一个机械师。

sentences.english: Gently the willow fluff wafts to the embroidered screen.
sentences.chinese: 游丝软系飘春榭，落絮轻沾扑绣帘。

sentences.english: Cantonese cuisine, the hardest to categorize, emphasizes light cooking with seemingly limitless range of ingredients.
sentences.chinese: 最难归类的粤菜强调轻炒浅煮，选料似乎不受限制。

sentences.english: Titanium is good, too, very light.
sentences.chinese: 钛金属也不错，轻巧得很。

sentences.english: The calming music, drowns out environmental noise, especially if it's mostly instrumental.
sentences.chinese: 轻音乐会掩盖周围的环境噪音，特别是器乐曲。

sentences.english: Silk, light and easily rolled up, could travel overland.
sentences.chinese: 丝绸很轻，且易卷，所以可以走陆路运输。

definition: low/beneath/to lower (one's head)/to let droop/to hang down/to incline
thin or slender/finely particulate/thin and soft/fine/delicate/trifling/(of a sound) quiet/frugal
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb
slow/unhurried/sluggish/gradual/not tense/relaxed/to postpone/to defer/to stall/to stave off/to revive/to recuperate
meager/slight/weak/ungenerous or unkind/frivolous/to despise/to belittle/to look down on/to approach or near
weak/feeble/young/inferior/(following a decimal or fraction) slightly less than
